docs.abstract: From our critics, reviews of closed gallery shows around New York City.
docs.snippet: From our critics, reviews of closed gallery shows around New York City.
docs.lead_paragraph: The front desk assistant here currently shares space with a giant snake. The sculpture, “Earth Eater” (2021), is a rainbow of stuffed textiles that starts on the floor with a mushy mouth, loops up over ceiling vents, then comes down and coils along a wall with the exhibition’s title: “Tura Oliveira: What a Glory to Be So Euphoric and Weak.”

docs.abstract: As a legislator for four decades, he led voter registration drives and challenges to redistricting that rattled the political establishment.
docs.snippet: As a legislator for four decades, he led voter registration drives and challenges to redistricting that rattled the political establishment.
docs.lead_paragraph: Albert Vann, who as a progressive New York State and New York City legislator for four decades helped shift the Black political center of gravity from Harlem to Brooklyn, where he challenged the white-dominated Democratic machine, died on Friday at his home in the Bedford-Stuyvesant section of the borough. He was 87.

headline.main: Albert Vann, Who Built a Black Power Base in Brooklyn, Dies at 87
headline.print_headline: Albert Vann, 87, Longtime Legislator Who Built a Black Base in Brooklyn

docs.abstract: Derek Chauvin, already serving more than 22 years in state prison for murder, pleaded guilty to federal charges that he used excessive force against Mr. Floyd and a 14-year-old boy.
docs.snippet: Derek Chauvin, already serving more than 22 years in state prison for murder, pleaded guilty to federal charges that he used excessive force against Mr. Floyd and a 14-year-old boy.
docs.lead_paragraph: ST. PAUL, Minn — A white Minneapolis police officer whose murder of a Black man outside a convenience store touched off protests around the world was sentenced to 21 years in federal prison on Thursday, in a case that signaled a new readiness to hold police officers criminally accountable for misconduct.

headline.main: Killer of George Floyd Sentenced to 21 Years for Violating Civil Rights
headline.print_headline: Chauvin Is Sentenced To 21 Years in a Case Of Civil Rights Violations

byline.original: By Jay Senter and Shaila Dewan

docs.abstract: Unlike some of their white peers, activists of color have pushed back sharply against the mayor’s aggressive approach to battling crime in New York City.
docs.snippet: Unlike some of their white peers, activists of color have pushed back sharply against the mayor’s aggressive approach to battling crime in New York City.
docs.lead_paragraph: Outside City Hall, as a nonprofit social justice group was unveiling a report about public safety for Black New Yorkers, Mayor Eric Adams suddenly emerged from the building.

headline.main: Black Leaders Are Conveying the Far Left’s Unease With Eric Adams
headline.print_headline: Black Leaders Convey Far Left’s Frustration With Adams Policies

docs.abstract: Is Eric Adams revealing himself to be the man the city needs?
docs.snippet: Is Eric Adams revealing himself to be the man the city needs?
docs.lead_paragraph: On a breezy June night in the Bronx, I was on the balcony at the restaurant Zona De Cuba, sipping a mojito, vibing to a salsa band and peeking at a special menu for the plant-based mayor of New York, Eric Adams, who was soon to arrive.

headline.print_headline: Eric Adams, Patrolling a City on Edge

docs.abstract: A powerful and relentlessly political exhibition takes on all the world’s crises — at the risk of conceptual overload.
docs.snippet: A powerful and relentlessly political exhibition takes on all the world’s crises — at the risk of conceptual overload.
docs.lead_paragraph: BERLIN — To imagine a new world, Karl Marx wrote in 1843 after studying in Berlin, you must first rigorously unpack the old one with “a ruthless criticism of everything existing.”

headline.main: Berlin Biennale Wrestles With Big Issues (and Itself)
headline.print_headline: A Biennale Wrestles With Big Issues (and Itself)

docs.abstract: With the superstar’s seventh solo studio album, “Renaissance,” due Friday, our critics and reporters debate which work from her past reveals the most about her artistic vision.
docs.snippet: With the superstar’s seventh solo studio album, “Renaissance,” due Friday, our critics and reporters debate which work from her past reveals the most about her artistic vision.
docs.lead_paragraph: Much is made of pop star “eras” these days, but the term is deployed as a tool of marketing, not meaning. Rare is the artist who can sustain multiple visions and repeatedly regenerate. But different cultural and social moments have demanded different Beyoncés, and she has consistently delivered. At times she has been a singles powerhouse, dominating the radio and pop charts. At others, she has announced herself as a seismic cultural force, playing on a field much bigger than music. On Friday she will release “Renaissance,” her seventh solo studio album. Below, eight New York Times critics and reporters choose what they believe to be her definitive album so far, the one that reveals the most truth about the scope and shape of her career.

docs.abstract: The House committee’s hearing on Thursday shed light on the Trump White House’s inaction as others urged to send troops to help quell the violence at the Capitol.
docs.snippet: The House committee’s hearing on Thursday shed light on the Trump White House’s inaction as others urged to send troops to help quell the violence at the Capitol.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — As the House committee investigating Jan. 6 used its prime-time hearing on Thursday to document President Donald J. Trump’s lack of forceful response to the attack on the Capitol by his supporters, it again raised one of the enduring mysteries of that day: Why did it take so long to deploy the National Guard?

headline.main: A Jan. 6 Mystery: Why Did It Take So Long to Deploy the National Guard?
headline.print_headline: Still a Mystery: The Delayed Arrival of the National Guard

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack

byline.original: By Mark Mazzetti and Maggie Haberman

docs.abstract: The remarks by Harbaugh, who was quoted as saying, “I believe in having the courage to let the unborn be born,” run counter to those expressed by the university’s interim president.
docs.snippet: The remarks by Harbaugh, who was quoted as saying, “I believe in having the courage to let the unborn be born,” run counter to those expressed by the university’s interim president.
docs.lead_paragraph: Jim Harbaugh, the University of Michigan’s head football coach, professed his anti-abortion views at a fund-raising event this week, becoming one of the first prominent sports figures to speak out against abortion since Roe v. Wade was overturned.

headline.main: Michigan Coach Jim Harbaugh Speaks at Anti-Abortion Event

keywords.value: Dobbs v Jackson Women's Health Organization (Supreme Court Decision)

docs.abstract: We invited teenagers to create an original five-minute podcast, using any style of podcasting and exploring a topic of their choice. We received podcast submissions from over 1,600 students. Here are the finalists.
docs.snippet: We invited teenagers to create an original five-minute podcast, using any style of podcasting and exploring a topic of their choice. We received podcast submissions from over 1,600 students. Here are the finalists.
docs.lead_paragraph: “Exploding Facts: How to Convince Your Parents to Let You Get a Pet,” by Mia Tweel, 12, is one of 10 winning entries from this year’s podcast contest.

headline.main: Winners of Our Fifth Annual Podcast Contest
